reviewText:
This was an amazing story, captured by the person living it.  Sure to make you think about what the Soldiers, Sailors, Airmen, and Marines are living every day while deployed, what they have to look forward to on their 2nd, 3rd, 4th, etc deployment.

Also, does a great job of showing the effect on the families left behind.  This a story that needed to be told, needs to be told to a broader audience, and should be mandatory viewing for those in running Government, most of whom have never lived this life.

This is the true 1% that the American People should be talking about, the 1% that serve in our Armed Forces.

Great insight and first-hand footage. I have never served, and learned a lot about what people who do serve encounter. I enjoy memoirs and first-person experiences, such as recollections of pioneer women. This storyline is best described as a movie memoir. In 20 years it will be a great time-capsule.
